author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Scientists at Carnegie Mellon University have engineered microscale robots from human lung stem cells that use cilia for precise movement. These biobots leverage genetic modifications to control cilia activity, enabling targeted navigation for potential therapeutic delivery.

Source Article: https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/sciadv.adx4176
